content: materials 200 yards worsted/aran weight yarn size m crochet hook gauge = 3 stitches per inch in single_crochet instructions start at crown with size m crochet hook or size to obtain gauge chain 3 and join into a ring with 1 slip_stitch in first chain round 1 chain 1 8 single_crochet in ring round 2 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around -- 16 single_crochet -- mark end of round round 3 1 single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet repeat to end of round round 4 1 single_crochet in next 3 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet repeat to end of round round 5 1 single_crochet in next 4 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet repeat to end of round round 6 1 single_crochet in next 5 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet repeat to end of round round 7 1 single_crochet in next 6 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet repeat to end of round round 8 1 single_crochet in next 7 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet repeat to end of round round 9 1 single_crochet in next 8 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet repeat to end of round round 10 1 single_crochet in next 9 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet repeat to end of round 54 single_crochet total work even until hat measures 7 inches from center of crown brim at end of round reverse and work 1 single_crochet in each single_crochet until brim measures 2 75 inches simply turn the hat around and place the next single_crochet in the single_crochet you just finished then continue to work around the hat as you have been doing reversing the direction of your work will create a fold for your brim tuck in loose ends and enjoy your new hat
